intro: Althaea spicata, commonly known as rose of Sharon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pale purple to white flowers that bloom in late summer. It has heart-shaped leaves and a robust, upright growth habit. Althaea spicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
